solution_line_template: First find the total weight of the hardcover books: {num_hardcover_books} books * {weight_hardcover_book} pound/book = <<{num_hardcover_books}*{weight_hardcover_book}={total_weight_hardcover}>>{total_weight_hardcover} pounds
Then find the total weight of the textbooks: {num_textbooks} books * {weight_textbook} pounds/book = <<{num_textbooks}*{weight_textbook}={total_weight_textbooks}>>{total_weight_textbooks} pounds

Then find the total weight of the knick-knacks: {num_knick_knacks} knick-knacks * {weight_knick_knack} pounds/knick-knack = <<{num_knick_knacks}*{weight_knick_knack}={total_weight_knick_knacks}>>{total_weight_knick_knacks} pounds

Then find the total weight of all the items: {total_weight_hardcover} pounds + {total_weight_textbooks} pounds + {total_weight_knick_knacks} pounds = <<{total_weight_hardcover}+{total_weight_textbooks}+{total_weight_knick_knacks}={total_collection_weight}>>{total_collection_weight} pounds

Then subtract the bookcase's weight limit: {total_collection_weight} pounds - {bookcase_weight_limit} pounds = <<{total_collection_weight}-{bookcase_weight_limit}={over_limit_pounds}>>{over_limit_pounds} pounds
